column4: Does someone know of a search tool which allows to send requests to multiple search engines like copernic can do in the windowsworld?
for an online tool, how about dogpile?
i ve never heard of this. is that some sort of meta websearch engine?
yeah
hm ok have an idea for a piece of software as well? i need my search history
how much search history? http://www.dogpile.com/_1_2S4GTKV02I6JE5O__info.dogpl/tbar/features.htm
scratch that, ie only
ie only ;) funny isnt it?
that must mean they've ceased to innovate, they have been around a while dogpile
maybe use Beagle with dogpile? http://beagle-project.org/Main_Page
thought beagle is desktop search only? no?
i ll have a look
in Gnome on Ubuntu, go to Places > Search, type in something you've recently searched for on the internet (e.g. i typed "ruby") and in addition to your desktop files it searches your web history
but perhaps what you need is something that re-runs the same searches?
hmm. yeah a rerun would be good. do you know copernic? http://www.copernic.com/en/products/agent/index.html its funky for more complex search projects
i've heard of it, but never had to use it
don't know how stable it is (verson 0.50), but development is ongoing and this looks like precisely the sort of app you're looking for: http://pinot.berlios.de/index.html
bingo this looks promising
let us know if it's any good :(
sorry, that was meant to be :)
i ll have a look at it
thanks for the tip
any time :)
